# privx_network_target (Resource)

PrivX Network Target

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "privx_access_group" "example" {
  name    = "example-target-group"
  comment = "Access group for network target"
}

resource "privx_role" "example" {
  name            = "example-target-role"
  access_group_id = privx_access_group.example.id

  permissions  = ["users-view"]
  permit_agent = false

  source_rules = jsonencode({
    type  = "GROUP"
    match = "ANY"
    rules = []
  })
}

resource "privx_network_target" "example" {
  name     = "example-network-target"
  disabled = false

  roles {
    id = privx_role.example.id
  }

  dst {
    ip_start = "192.168.1.1"
    ip_end   = "192.168.1.50"
    protocol = "tcp"
  }
}
```

## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String)

### Optional

- `comment` (String)
- `disabled` (Boolean)
- `dst` (Block List) Destination endpoints (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--dst))
- `exclusive_access` (Boolean)
- `integration_type` (String)
- `roles` (Block List) PrivX roles allowed for this network target (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--roles))
- `src_nat` (Boolean)
- `static_config` (String)
- `tags` (List of String)
- `user_instructions` (String)

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedblock--dst"></a>
### Nested Schema for `dst`

Required:

- `ip_end` (String)
- `ip_start` (String)

Optional:

- `nat_addr` (String)
- `nat_port` (Number)
- `port_end` (Number)
- `port_start` (Number)
- `protocol` (String)
